column2:
- This page gives a brief narrative overview of what's in the following sheets
- "FY total" sheet gives you the full year snapshot and shows you how it compares to this current year and previous years
- "Payroll overview" gives a brief overview of what's included in current payroll figures in terms of number of people, roles and rates
- "Non-payroll expenses" sheet gives more information about our non-staffing costs
- "Income detail" sheet shows breakdown of both earned revenue and fundraised funds

There are still guesses for where we will end FY25 including  final summer revenue and individual donations will bring clearer picture to the budget before it's passed by the board in July. Today, review this for big picture questions, concerns, and considerations rather than drilling too deep into line item details (we'll do that later!)

- Staffing capacity decreased to reflect grant loss. This budget includes the reduction of 4 field staff and one leadership role.
- All remaining staff will get a 4% cost of living adjustment (not including E.D.)
- Health benefits: Current estimates is $41,000 (after quotes from insurance broker) and includes for all year-round permanent staff who will elect to take benefits (7 people). Assumes 75% coverage by us, 25% buy in from staff. 
- Reduction in several expense areas  - no annual retreat, no professional development bank, no gear stipend, slight reduction in gear and supplies cost vs anticipate actuals for FY 25

- This assumes an slight increase in fundraised funds from individual donors. This winter was a particulary bad year (aiming to get back to a more typical winter even with current environment - Sammy shifting energy from grant reporting and grant finances to fundraising
- Currently 0 grants are secured for FY25. Awaiting notice on 2 large grants should find out about $40,000 by end of June. Anything in Blue is good chance, yellow is decent chance, orange is unknown. All grants listed specifically have either been applied to already or we have recieved funding from that entity previously
- Earned revenue increases with slight price increases and increase in # of Nature Preschool spots. Expecting decrease in Exploreres Club and Neighborhood Nature - but mostly offset by price increase and increase in nature preschool. ____ Events and Sponsorships - have been succesfull this year with increasing these funding sources - we know have a much larger network of business with history of funding - anticipating bringing some back in FY 26 who did not give in FY25 and losing some who gave in FY 25

There is uncertainty with income next year due to the current funding environment. Community or school programs could be cut or decreased in January 2026 if revenue is not shaping up as hoped. Our payroll budget includes some part time staff who could be cut/not hired if programs do not fillThis would be the first lever we pull to bring expesnses down. This budget includes significant expense reduction and significant reduction of capacity. On the flipside - if things go well, first priorty will be to bring back gear stipends (about $3,000) and revisit cuts made to non payroll expenses.
